Event.0: Pope Felix IV died, having named Boniface II as his successor.
Event.1: American baseball player, manager, and coach Yogi Berra, who won a record 10 World Series while a catcher with the New York Yankees and was known for his unintentionally amusing non sequiters, died at age 90.
Event.2: CERN scientists announce their discovery of neutrinos breaking the speed of light
Event.3: Hundreds of thousands of rural protesters converged on London to demonstrate in favour of foxhunting, which two years later the House of Commons banned in England and Wales.
Event.4: Actress Patsy Kensit (32) divorces Oasis singer Liam Gallagher (28) due to unreasonable behaviour after 3 years of marriage
Event.5: "Friends" TV sitcom created by David Crane and Marta Kauffman debuts on NBC, starring Jennifer Aniston, Courteney Cox, Lisa Kudrow, Matt LeBlanc, Matthew Perry and David Schwimmer
Event.6: American composer Irving Berlin, who was perhaps the greatest and most enduring of American songwriters, died in New York City.
Event.7: The Iran-Iraq War began when Iraqi armed forces invaded western Iran along the countries' joint border; fighting continued until 1988, and a formal peace agreement was signed in 1990.
Event.8:
Solidarity formed
Solidarity, the Polish trade union and political party that became a hotbed of resistance to Soviet control, was founded this day in 1980 when delegates of 36 unions met and united under the leadership of Lech Wałęsa.
Event.9: Iraq invades Iran in an attempt to control the Shatt al-Arab waterway
Event.11: India and Pakistan ceases-fire goes into effect, ending Indo-Pakistani War
Event.12: Italian opera tenor Andrea Bocelli, who was noted for his unique blend of opera and pop music, was born.
Event.13:
Andrea Bocelli
Italian singer
was born
Event.14:
Nick Cave
Australian singer-songwriter, actor, and screenwriter
was born
Event.15: Jean Decoux, the French governor-general of Indochina appointed by the Vichy government after the fall of France, concluded an agreement with the Japanese that permitted the stationing of 30,000 Japanese troops in Indochina.
Event.16: "Adventures of Superman" actor George Reeves (26) weds Ellanora Needles at the Church of Our Savior in San Gabriel, California
Event.17: Gene Tunney successfully defended his world heavyweight boxing title by defeating Jack Dempsey after the controversial “long count” in the seventh round.
Event.18: Chinese-born American theoretical physicist Chen Ning Yang, corecipient with Tsung-Dao Lee of the Nobel Prize for Physics in 1957, was born.
Event.19: Chicago grand jury convenes to investigate charges that 8 White Sox players conspired to fix the 1919 World Series
Event.20:
Ilse Koch
German war criminal
was born
Event.21: Richard Wagner's opera "Rhine Gold" premieres in Munich
Event.22: US President Abraham Lincoln says he will free slaves in all states on Jan 1
Event.23: Future railroad magnate Mark Hopkins Jr. marries Mary Sherwood
Event.24: Physicist Alessandro Volta (49) weds Teresa Peregrini
Event.25: French First Republic formed by the National Convention, stripping French king of his powers
Event.26: American officer Nathan Hale was hanged by the British for spying during the American Revolution.
Event.27: Last people hanged for witchcraft (8) in the US, 20 hanged overall during Salem witch trials
Event.28: Spain's Philip III issued a royal order for deportation of the Moriscos (Christians of Moorish ancestry).
Event.29:
Anne of Cleves
queen of England
was born
